description: The round payoff this round was 118. You, John chose to play option 1.Kate chose to play option 1. You received a payoff of 59.
This is a coordination game with elements of a prisoner's dilemma, because mutual cooperation (both choosing option 1) yields the highest total payoff
In the one recorded round, both players chose option 1, suggesting they successfully coordinated on the optimal collective strategy
There's a temptation to defect (choose option 2) when the other player chooses option 1, as this would yield 75% of half the payoff rather than 50% of the full payoff
Trust appears to have been established in the first recorded round, as both players chose the mutually beneficial option
The game creates tension between individual and collective rationality, as individually there might be incentive to choose option 2, but collectively option 1 is better
